answer:
• Advection fog: moist warm air moves over colder land or water
  • Radiation fog: forms on clear nights with little or no wind and only over land
  • Upslope: moist unstable air is cooled as wind pushes it up a slope
  • Precipitation Induced fog: warm rain falls through cool air. Evaporation from the rain saturates the cool air and fog forms
  • Steam fog: forms when cold, dry air moves over warm water
  • Ice fog: Occurs in very cold air when ice crystals form directly from moisture in the air
